item.title: CORS
item.description: What’s CORS # CORS is a mechanism to stop you from accessing resource in one origin from another origin. For example, there is an image img.jpg from origin images.com, if you don’t have CORS set properly, you can’t access the img.jpg from other origins like yourOrigin.com. Why needs CORS # CORS is mainly for security usage. Image that your browser stores credential cookies of domain bank.com which is the website of you bank account, and a hacking website hacking.
